file_content.text: We are your talons and eyes, Sky Hunter.
We are your talons and eyes, Ember Fist.
We are your talons and eyes, Silent Teeth.
I am newborn before this galaxy. My memories are gray and pale, against this brightness.
My people's song needs new tones, to grow. I must seek these out before our raging cousins hear them.
You said your people are driven to annihilate other species, but you opposed it. Why?
You're not like other Esh-kha.
I first breathed in a time when we overflowed onto world after world, behind our patriarch.
A patriarch grows alone, towering over a forest of warriors and savants. A new growth springs only when he falls.
But, I birthed when the patriarch was still growing and green. Two patriarchs--a sudden, sharp brightness indeed.
My thoughts of peace were ice to my brothers' fire. This spoke clearly. My leaving would be the seed of a new forest, elsewhere.
Your population had grown too big and needed to split. Your "unusual" ideas helped it happen.
The Esh-kha had to divide.
That is straight and shining.
Wouldn't you have rather stayed with your brothers?
Did you want to leave?
I am a patriarch. My footsteps cannot be my own, they must beat a path.
So you simply left, when your ideas could have conquered the other Esh-kha.
You could have declared war.
Cut off my left hand with my right? That gibbers and writhes, Sky Hunter.
Cut off my left hand with my right? That gibbers and writhes, Ember Fist.
Cut off my left hand with my right? That gibbers and writhes, Silent Teeth.
Our steps were turned by the Rakata, and their black silence, but the path still waits for us.
Because of you, we shall walk it again.
How do you intend to lead your people once we've faced the Empire?
What about after the war?
I would join our voices to your Republic's chorus, Sky Hunter, but that is a far horizon.
I would join our voices to your Republic's chorus, Ember Fist, but that is a far horizon.
I would join our voices to your Republic's chorus, Silent Teeth, but that is a far horizon.
Much closer is breeding, and calming, and being. The Rakata and their blackness scored wounds that must heal.
First, we shield your Republic's harmony. Or all this pours into an abyss.
I'm sure new people and places will be good for you. Farewell.
Good. I must be going.
Walk safely.
My thanks again, for breathing life into us.
Much is reborn. I have not walked between planets in a star's birth of time.
What planet did the Esh-kha originally come from?
Where is your homeworld?
That name is a dry leaf, long blown away.
I'm happy to give you the chance again, Hallow Voice.
It's good to have you along.
Patriarch, warrior, savant. Once, our wave washed world after world.
We... drowned other species. Our raging brothers poured upon them. I was cold and still with watching.
I heard your people once tried to cleanse the galaxy of all sentient species.
I know of this.
That is... deep and clear, Sky Hunter.
That is... deep and clear, Ember Fist.
That is... deep and clear, Silent Teeth.
I can scarcely imagine such a cataclysm.
It must have been terrible.
On Belsavis, my dream-steps marked those dead worlds.
If you'd spoken out, the other Esh-kha would have listened to you.
You should have stopped them.
They were blank stone to me.
To my unkind brothers, all thinking life is... a rock that floats. A tree upside down. The sky gone from over their heads.
When we speak of such things, we use the word "abomination."
I understand your meaning.
Hmm. That tone resonates true.
Go over that again.
Can't you ever give a simple answer to a question?
More Esh-kha gibberish.
You think, but your thoughts are empty of patriarch, or savant. To my brothers, this is a broken, screaming horror that must be ended.
You and your followers aren't violent. You tried to work with other races.
But you're different.
I am ice, to my brothers' fire.
Could your brothers ever cooperate with other races, like you?
Perhaps that could change.
Could you and your shadow be split? This is lodged deep in us. But, not in me.
I think incarceration on Belsavis was the best thing for them.
They deserved imprisonment.
It is a great weight to carry, Sky Hunter.
It is a great weight to carry, Ember Fist.
It is a great weight to carry, Silent Teeth.
It was my pleasure. Sorry, but I must go.
You're welcome. Goodbye.
Go well, Sky Hunter.
Go well, Ember Fist.
Go well, Silent Teeth.
Freedom is honey and wine.
You deserved to be free.
